intro: Boehmeria grewiifolia, commonly known as the giant nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Boehmeria grewiifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
